definition: bubble/foam/blister (i.e. skin bubble)/to soak/to steep/to infuse/to dawdle/to shilly-shally/to hang about/to pick up (a girl)/to get off with (a sexual partner)/classifier for occurrences of an action/classifier for number of infusions
puffed/swollen/spongy/small lake (esp. in place names)/classifier for urine or feces

sentences.english: But those hopes were dashed after North Korea was caught hiding its nuclear program.
sentences.chinese: 但在朝鮮被發現隱藏核計劃後，那些希望就化爲泡影。

sentences.english: Hopes of a peace settlement faded.
sentences.chinese: 和平解決的希望成爲泡影。

sentences.english: All his hopes and plans had come to nothing .
sentences.chinese: 他的一切希望和計劃都成泡影。

sentences.english: But his dominance often curdles into desperation.
sentences.chinese: 但他的優勢常常化成絕望泡影。

sentences.english: The plans for the town's new shopping centre were given the kiss of death by reductions in government spending.
sentences.chinese: 該鎮建新的購物中心的計劃因政府削減而終成泡影。

sentences.english: A plot to overthrow the government.
sentences.chinese: 他們推翻政府的企圖終成泡影。

sentences.english: The war cut off all his hopes.
sentences.chinese: 這場戰爭使他所有的希望都化成了泡影。

sentences.english: Its modernizing aims were dashed in the face of reality.
sentences.chinese: 大躍進的現代化目標在現實面前化爲泡影。

sentences.english: Our holiday plans went phut when the cost of living rose again.
sentences.chinese: 生活費用又漲了，我們的度假計劃成了泡影。

sentences.english: So all our dreams of being millionaires went up in smoke.
sentences.chinese: 所以，我們想成爲百萬富翁的美夢全部成了泡影。

sentences.english: Owing to lack of support the scheme fizzled out.
sentences.chinese: 由於沒人支持，這一計劃終成泡影。

sentences.english: Now, alas, must my fond hopes all vanish.
sentences.chinese: 可現在一切希望均成泡影。

sentences.english: My plans were thwarted by the weather.
sentences.chinese: 天公不作美，我的計劃成泡影。

sentences.english: His dream of becoming a superstar ended in bubbles.
sentences.chinese: 他想成爲超級明星的夢想終成泡影。

sentences.english: Their attempt to overthrow the government ended in nothing.
sentences.chinese: 他們推翻政府的企圖終成泡影。

definition: to go up in smoke/to vanish
lit. flowers in a mirror and the moon reflected in the lake (idiom)/fig. an unrealistic rosy view/viewing things through rose-tinted spectacles/also written 水月鏡花|水月镜花
to commit to the waters (idiom); to lose sth irrevocably
to vanish like smoke in thin air/to disappear
see 黃粱夢|黄粱梦[huang2 liang2 meng4]
to be shattered/to be annihilated (of hope, illusions etc)
using a wicker basket to draw water (idiom); wasted effort
